sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Ouids banquet of sence A coronet for his mistresse philosophie, and his amorous zodiacke. VVith a translation of a Latine coppie, written by a fryer, anno Dom. 1400. Ovids banquet of sence. Chapman, George, 1559?-1634. Stapleton, Richard, fl. 1595, attributed name. Map, Walter, fl. 1200. Phillis and Flora. English. R. S., Esquire.
[72] p.
Printed by I[ames] R[oberts] for Richard Smith, At London : Anno Dom. 1595.
Dedication signed: George Chapman. The "Latine coppie" is "Phillis and Flora", attributed to Walter Map. In a separate reprinting (STC 19880) this translation is attributed to R.S. Esquire, i.e. Richard Stapleton?. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-I⁴. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[72] p.
Printed by I[ames] R[oberts] for Richard Smith, At London : Anno Dom. 1595.
Dedication signed: George Chapman. The "Latine coppie" is "Phillis and Flora", attributed to Walter Map. In a separate reprinting (STC 19880) this translation is attributed to R.S.
